description: Ancient Greek χλωρός (khlōrós, “light green”) + φαίνω (phaínō, “show, shine”). Compare French chlorophane.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A variety of fluorspar, which, when heated, gives a striking emerald-green light.

entries.meaning: (biology) The yellowish-green pigment in the inner segment of the cones of the retina.
